definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: If the results are not for the current year, please indicate that the year of the entry.
sentences.chinese: 如非本年度所考獲之成績，請註明應考年份。

sentences.english: But the study does not recommend that those taking exams use stimulants to boost their heart rate.
sentences.chinese: 但研究並不建議應考學生飲用興奮劑飲料來增加心率。

sentences.english: All I is study and take exams.
sentences.chinese: 我做的一切就是學習和應考。

sentences.english: All I do is study and take exams.
sentences.chinese: 我做的一切就是學習和應考。

sentences.english: Personnel must score at least 80% on the examination paper.
sentences.chinese: 應考者必須取得至少80%的卷面分。

sentences.english: He's been cramming for his exams all week.
sentences.chinese: 他整個星期都一直在拼命準備應考。

definition: employee/person employed in a trade or profession
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
